intro: Erysimum asperum var. dolichocarpum, commonly known as the long-seed wallflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, linear leaves that are often glandular. Its flowers are yellow or orange, appearing in late spring to early summer, and the long, slender pods are a distinguishing feature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas.
